contentrichtext.text: {{Wiktionary|Pakal}} '''Pakal''' may refer to: ==Items relating to the Mayans== '''Pakal''' (also spelled '''Pacal'''; meaning "[[shield]]" in several [[Maya languages]]) forms the (common) name or part of the full name of several pre-Columbian Maya personages identified in the monumental inscriptions of sites in the Maya region of [[Mesoamerica]]. As such this may refer to: At [[Palenque]]: * [[Janaab' Pakal]] (d. 612) aka Janaab' Pakal "the Elder", among others * [[K'inich Janaab' Pakal]] (603–683), aka Pakal "the Great", or "Sun-Shield"; reigned 68 years, 11th dynastic ruler * [[Upakal K'inich Janaab' Pakal]] (fl. c. 742), aka Upakal K'inich, U Pakal K'inich, K'inich Janaab' Pakal (II); 15th dynastic ruler * [[Wak Kimi Janaab' Pakal]] (fl. c. 799), aka 6 Kimi Pakal, Janaab' Pakal (III); last known named ruler at Palenque *[[Lady Pacal]] of Yaxchilan At [[Chichen Itza]]: * [[K'ak'upakal]] (fl. 9th century), aka K'ak' Upakal; mid to late 9th century ruler at Chichen Itza ==Places in Iran== * [[Pakal, Markazi]] ==Other uses== * [[Pakal (film)|''Pakal'' (film)]], a 2006 film * ''[[Pakal Nakshatrangal]]'', a 2008 Malayalam film written & directed by Rajeev Nath {{dab}}
